conclusion: Determine the magnitude of the electric force experienced by the small ball S_1 at point M.
Find the electric field at point M due to the charges at points A and B.
The distance between O and M is sqrt(2)L.
M lies on the perpendicular bisector of the line segment AB.
Calculate electric field at M due to charge Q at A using Coulomb's law: E_A = kQ/(OM^2) = kQ/(2L^2)
M is symmetrically placed with respect to the line segment AB.
Electric field vectors due to charges at A and B are in opposite directions but equal in magnitude.
Net electric field at M is E_M = E_A + E_B = 2E_A = kQ/L^2
Direction of E_M points towards the central charge of the system at O.
Charge on the ball S_1 is Q.
Electric force F on S_1 by field at M is F = Q * E_M = kQ^2/L^2
Direction of force F is towards point O.
Magnitude of electric force experienced by the small ball S_1 at point M is kQ^2/L^2
